COMMA Notation Guide

Kimberly Webb

2024-04-23

COMMA_Notation_Guide.Rmd

This guide is designed to summarize key notation and quantities used the COMMA R Package and associated publications.

Term Definition Description
XX ‚Äì Predictor matrix for the true mediator and outcome.
CC ‚Äì Covariate matrix for the true mediator and outcome.
ZZ ‚Äì Predictor matrix for the observed mediator, conditional on the true mediator
YY ‚Äì Outcome variable.
M M‚àà{1,2}M \in \{1, 2\} True binary mediator. Reference category is 2.
mijm_{ij} ùïÄ{Mi=j}\mathbb{I}\{M_i = j\} Indicator for the true binary mediator.
M*M^* M*‚àà{1,2}M^* \in \{1, 2\} Observed binary mediator. Reference category is 2.
mi‚Ñì*m^*_{i \ell} ùïÄ{Mi*=‚Ñì}\mathbb{I}\{M^*_i = \ell \} Indicator for the observed binary mediator.
True Mediator Mechanism logit{P(M=1|X,C;Œ≤)}=Œ≤0+Œ≤XX+Œ≤CC\text{logit} \{ P(M = 1 | X, C ; \beta) \} = \beta_{0} + \beta_{X} X + \beta_{C} C Relationship between XX and CC and the true mediator, MM.
Observed Mediator Mechanism logit{P(M*=1|M=m,Z;Œ≥)}=Œ≥1m0+Œ≥1mZZ\text{logit}\{ P(M^* = 1 | M = m, Z ; \gamma) \} = \gamma_{1m0} + \gamma_{1mZ} Z Relationship between ZZ and the observed mediator, M*M^*, given the true mediator MM.
Outcome Mechanism E(Y|X,C,M;Œ∏)}=Œ∏0+Œ∏XX+Œ∏CCŒ∏MM+Œ∏XMXME(Y| X, C, M ; \theta) \} = \theta{0} + \theta_{X} X + \theta_{C} C \theta_{M}M + \theta_{XM}XM Relationship between XX, CC, and MM and the outcome of interest YY.
œÄij\pi_{ij} P(Mi=j|X,C;Œ≤)=exp{Œ≤j0+Œ≤jXXi+Œ≤jCCi}1+exp{Œ≤j0+Œ≤jXXi+Œ≤jCCi}P(M_i = j | X, C ; \beta) = \frac{\text{exp}\{\beta_{j0} + \beta_{jX} X_i + \beta_{jC} C_i\}}{1 + \text{exp}\{\beta_{j0} + \beta_{jX} X_i + \beta_{jC} C_i\}} Response probability for individual ii‚Äôs true mediator category.
œÄi‚Ñìj*\pi^*_{i \ell j} P(Mi*=‚Ñì|Mi=j,Z;Œ≥)=exp{Œ≥‚Ñìj0+Œ≥‚ÑìjZZi}1+exp{Œ≥‚Ñìj0+Œ≥kjZZi}P(M^*_i = \ell | M_i = j, Z ; \gamma) = \frac{\text{exp}\{\gamma_{\ell j 0} + \gamma_{ \ell jZ} Z_i\}}{1 + \text{exp}\{\gamma_{\ell j0} + \gamma_{kjZ} Z_i\}} Response probability for individual ii‚Äôs observed mediator category, conditional on the true mediator.
œÄi‚Ñì*\pi^*_{i \ell} P(Mi*=‚Ñì|Mi,X,Z;Œ≥)=‚àëj=12œÄi‚Ñìj*œÄijP(M^*_i = \ell | M_i, X, Z ; \gamma) = \sum_{j = 1}^2 \pi^*_{i \ell j} \pi_{ij} Response probability for individual ii‚Äôs observed mediator cateogry.
œÄjj*\pi^*_{jj} P(M*=j|M=j,Z;Œ≥)=‚àëi=1NœÄijj*P(M^* = j | M = j, Z ; \gamma) = \sum_{i = 1}^N \pi^*_{ijj} Average probability of correct classification for category jj.
Sensitivity P(M*=1|M=1,Z;Œ≥)=‚àëi=1NœÄi11*P(M^* = 1 | M = 1, Z ; \gamma) = \sum_{i = 1}^N \pi^*_{i11} True positive rate. Average probability of observing mediator k=1k = 1, given the true mediator j=1j = 1.
Specificity P(M*=2|M=2,Z;Œ≥)=‚àëi=1NœÄi22*P(M^* = 2 | M = 2, Z ; \gamma) = \sum_{i = 1}^N \pi^*_{i22} True negative rate. Average probability of observing mediator k=2k = 2, given the true mediator j=2j = 2.
Œ≤X\beta_X ‚Äì Association parameter of interest in the true mediator mechanism.
Œ≥11Z\gamma_{11Z} ‚Äì Association parameter of interest in the observed mediator mechanism, given j=1j=1.
Œ≥12Z\gamma_{12Z} ‚Äì Association parameter of interest in the observed mediator mechanism, given j=2j=2.
Œ∏X\theta_X ‚Äì Association parameter of interest in the outcome mechanism.
Œ∏M\theta_M ‚Äì Association parameter relating the true mediator to the outcome.
Œ∏XM\theta_{XM} ‚Äì Association parameter for the interaction between XX and MM in the outcome mechanism.
